body_html:
@mrry yeah , I have a network of following kind :

        h3 = conv1d(h2, s2, size=3, rate=2, scope="d_h3_conv")
        h3 = tf.layers.batch_normalization(h3)
        h3 = tf.nn.leaky_relu(h3)
        
        h4 = tf.contrib.layers.flatten(h3)
   
        #h5 = tf.layers.dense(h4,1, activation=None, name="d_h5_lin")
        h5 = tf.layers.dense(h4,1)

and it throws up the above error (ValueError: The last dimension of the inputs to Dense should be defined. Found None.) But as I am working on audio dataset , hence I have a variable amount of dimension depending upon the number of timesteps , instead of using flatten I even tried using tf.reshape along with tf.get_shape to make it work but to no avail.
body_text:
@mrry  yeah , I have a network of following kind :
        h3 = conv1d(h2, s2, size=3, rate=2, scope="d_h3_conv")
        h3 = tf.layers.batch_normalization(h3)
        h3 = tf.nn.leaky_relu(h3)
        
        h4 = tf.contrib.layers.flatten(h3)
   
        #h5 = tf.layers.dense(h4,1, activation=None, name="d_h5_lin")
        h5 = tf.layers.dense(h4,1)

and it throws up the above error (ValueError: The last dimension of the inputs to Dense should be defined. Found None.) But as I am working on audio dataset , hence I have a variable amount of dimension depending upon the number of timesteps , instead of using flatten I even tried using  tf.reshape along with tf.get_shape to make it work but to no avail.
body:
@mrry  yeah , I have a network of following kind : 
```
        h3 = conv1d(h2, s2, size=3, rate=2, scope="d_h3_conv")
        h3 = tf.layers.batch_normalization(h3)
        h3 = tf.nn.leaky_relu(h3)
        
        h4 = tf.contrib.layers.flatten(h3)
   
        #h5 = tf.layers.dense(h4,1, activation=None, name="d_h5_lin")
        h5 = tf.layers.dense(h4,1)
```

and it throws up the above error (ValueError: The last dimension of the inputs to Dense should be defined. Found None.) But as I am working on audio dataset , hence I have a variable amount of dimension depending upon the number of timesteps , instead of using flatten I even tried using  tf.reshape along with tf.get_shape to make it work but to no avail.
